metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3611 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
A stack overflow vulnerability was found in the Intel HD Audio device(intel-hda) of QEMU. A malicious guest could use this flaw to crash theQEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service condition. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This flawaffects QEMU versions prior to 7.0.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-block-extra - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-guest-agent - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-kvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-arm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-common - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-data - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-gui - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-mips - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-misc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-ppc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-s390x - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-sparc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86 - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-user - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-user-static - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
qemu-utils - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16').
